import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.75efeacb:
df_housing.plot(
kind='scatter',
x='longitude',
y='latitude',
alpha=0.4,
s=df_housing['population']/100,
label='population',
c='median_house_value',
cmap=plt.get_cmap('jet'),
colorbar=True,
figsize=(12,9))
plt.legend()
plt.show()

source.52826138:
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(12,12))
ax = fig.add_subplot(projection='3d')

ax.scatter(df_housing['housing_median_age'], df_housing['median_income'], df_housing['median_house_value'], c=df_housing['median_house_value'], alpha=0.4)
ax.set_xlabel('median age')
ax.set_ylabel('median income')
ax.set_zlabel('median house value')

source.0450e04d: Houses in the West or by the sea are more expensive than houses in other locations in California.
